Text: So that's what happened...
I see!

Sergey Gorman is skilled enough as a swordsman to
pierce through Gamma's defenses... We shouldn't
underestimate him.
He was also aware of the Shadow Garden's existence.

Can we assume that knowledge of the Shadow Garden's
existence is widespread among the Diablos Children?
I'm not...sure about that.

Sergey mentioned that he never expected us to be
real, which suggests he didn't fully trust the intel.

But during our mission to rescue No. 93, didn't the
Cult members mention that they had heard about
us from Fenrir?

However, No. 111, a Named Child, knew nothing about
the Garden—

In other words, intel about the Shadow Garden within
the Cult of Diablos is inconsistent.
The Cult is far from united!

Depending on their position, they might lack access
to certain information, be completely unaware of it,
or be hesitant to trust the intel they possess.

Within large organizations like the Cult, differences
in the accuracy of intel and the willingness to share
it are likely to arise among members based on rank
and faction.

Assuming the Fenrir sect, a significant faction
within Midgar Kingdom, is already aware of us...

Perhaps those connected to the Cult within the
Velgalta Empire may not even know our existence.

...Eta, do you have any further insights to share
about Sergey's combat abilities?
Hmm...

I do. When I was generating electricity with
No. 111... I heard lots of things...

Wait a moment, Eta! If you heard something, why
didn't you include that in your report?

You prioritized your experiment on generating
electricity, didn't you?

Heheh... You get it, Epsilon. Next time, I wanna get
you to peddle...instead of No. 111.
No thanks.

It helps tone your body and enhance your figure.
It's great for your appearance.
What?!
...Nice try, but I'm not falling for that!
But it's true...
So, do you have any more details to share?

I heard something about his wounds healing like
Malak.
Seriously?!

It's not as if his wounds heal...instantly...
like Malak...

But when you attacked him, Gamma...even the areas
pierced by your sword recovered quickly.

I couldn't observe it up close, so I don't have
confirmation, but I checked with No. 111 and
cross-referenced it.

It appears Sergey indeed possesses that kind of
regenerative power.

N-No way... That means I couldn't have won that fight
no matter what!

Instant regeneration... It's beyond human
capabilities. Could he be using some ancient
artifact?

Even with our powerful magical abilities achieved
through being healed from our possession, it's tricky
to instantly regenerate from significant injuries.

Sergey's strength as a formidable opponent could be
attributed to his regenerative abilities.

Confronting the Cult of Diablos means facing
adversaries with such capabilities!

How are we supposed to win against adversaries like
that?!

Hmm... Well, in that case, we could...use slime...
and stick it to areas we slice.
That's a good idea!

If the slime residue interferes with magic healing
and regeneration... Yes, it could indeed serve as
an effective countermeasure!

I'll work on modifying our slime swords, but I want a
substantial research budget for that.
Hey, Eta! Quit trying to sneak that in—
We'll give it to you. Won't we, Gamma?
Seriously?!
Heheh... Heehee!
...So, wanna pedal?
I'm not pedaling!
